intro: Khoonmengia honbaensis, commonly known as the Honbaense plant, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Khoonmengia honbaensis is adapted to cool, humid climates and thrives in well-drained, nutrient-rich soils. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in several conservation areas.
